query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Come si volgon per tenera nube 11 due archi paralelli e concolori, 12 quando Iunone a sua ancella iube,
13 nascendo di quel d’entro quel di fori, 14 a guisa del parlar di quella vaga 15 ch’amor consunse come sol vapori,
16 e fanno qui la gente esser presaga, 17 per lo patto che Dio con Noè puose, 18 del mondo che già mai più non s’allaga:
19 così di quelle sempiterne rose 20 volgiensi circa noi le due ghirlande, 21 e sì l’estrema a l’intima rispuose.
query.result:
10 As they turn for tender cloud 11 two parallel and like‑colored arches, 12 when Juno ordered her handmaid,
13 being born of that from inside that from outside, 14 in the manner of the speech of that vague 15 that love consumed like only vapors,
16 and they make here the people be pre‑foretold, 17 by the pact that God with Noah placed, 18 of the world that already never again will be flooded:
19 thus of those everlasting roses 20 turn around us the two garlands, 21 and thus the extreme to the intimate answered.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Degno è che, dov’ è l’un, l’altro s’induca: 35 sì che, com’ elli ad una militaro, 36 così la gloria loro insieme luca.
query.result: 34 It is worthy that, where the one is, the other may be drawn: 35 so that, as they to one I enlist, 36 thus their glory together shines.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 L’essercito di Cristo, che sì caro 38 costò a rïarmar, dietro a la ’nsegna 39 si movea tardo, sospeccioso e raro,
40 quando lo ’mperador che sempre regna 41 provide a la milizia, ch’era in forse, 42 per sola grazia, non per esser degna;
43 e, come è detto, a sua sposa soccorse 44 con due campioni, al cui fare, al cui dire 45 lo popol disvïato si raccorse.

Please translate each line literally into English.
46 In quella parte ove surge ad aprire 47 Zefiro dolce le novelle fronde 48 di che si vede Europa rivestire,
49 non molto lungi al percuoter de l’onde 50 dietro a le quali, per la lunga foga, 51 lo sol talvolta ad ogne uom si nasconde,
52 siede la fortunata Calaroga 53 sotto la protezion del grande scudo 54 in che soggiace il leone e soggioga:
55 dentro vi nacque l’amoroso drudo 56 de la fede cristiana, il santo atleta 57 benigno a’ suoi e a’ nemici crudo;
58 e come fu creata, fu repleta 59 sì la sua mente di viva vertute 60 che, ne la madre, lei fece profeta.
query.result:
46 In that part where it rises to open 47 Sweet Zephyr the new leaves 48 of which one sees Europe dress,
49 not far away at the striker of the waves 50 behind which, for the long haste, 51 the sun sometimes to every man hides itself,
52 the fortunate Calaroga sits 53 under the protection of the great shield 54 in which the lion lies and subjugates:
55 inside there was born the loving drudo 56 of the Christian faith, the holy athlete 57 kind to his own and to the enemies cruel;
58 and as it was created, it was filled 59 so its mind with living virtues 60 that, in the mother, she made prophet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Poi che le sponsalizie fuor compiute 62 al sacro fonte intra lui e la Fede, 63 u’ si dotar di mutüa salute,
64 la donna che per lui l’assenso diede, 65 vide nel sonno il mirabile frutto 66 ch’uscir dovea di lui e de le rede;
67 e perché fosse qual era in costrutto, 68 quinci si mosse spirito a nomarlo 69 del possessivo di cui era tutto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Domenico fu detto; e io ne parlo 71 sì come de l’agricola che Cristo 72 elesse a l’orto suo per aiutarlo.
query.result: 70 Domenico was called; and I speak of it 71 as of the farmer that Christ 72 chose to his garden to help him

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo: 74 che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, 75 fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo.
query.result: 73 Ben parve messo e famigliar di Cristo: – It seemed well placed and familiar of Christ: 74 che ’l primo amor che ’n lui fu manifesto, – that the first love that in him was manifest, 75 fu al primo consiglio che diè Cristo. – was to the first counsel that gave Christ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Spesse fïate fu tacito e desto 77 trovato in terra da la sua nutrice, 78 come dicesse: ‘Io son venuto a questo’.
query.result: 76 Often fates was silent and this 77 found on earth by his nurse, 78 as he said: “I am come to this”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Oh padre suo veramente Felice! 80 oh madre sua veramente Giovanna, 81 se, interpretata, val come si dice!
82 Non per lo mondo, per cui mo s’affanna 83 di retro ad Ostïense e a Taddeo, 84 ma per amor de la verace manna
85 in picciol tempo gran dottor si feo; 86 tal che si mise a circüir la vigna 87 che tosto imbianca, se ’l vignaio è reo.
query.result:
79 Oh his father truly Happy! 80 oh his mother truly Giovanna, 81 if, interpreted, it is worth as it is said!
82 Not for the world, for which now it strains 83 from behind to Ostiense and to Taddeo, 84 but for love of the true manna
85 in short time great doctor he became; 86 so that he set himself to walk around the vineyard 87 that soon whitens, if the vineyard is guilty.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 E a la sedia che fu già benigna 89 più a’ poveri giusti, non per lei, 90 ma per colui che siede, che traligna,
91 non dispensare o due o tre per sei, 92 non la fortuna di prima vacante, 93 non decimas, quae sunt pauperum Dei,
94 addimandò, ma contro al mondo errante 95 licenza di combatter per lo seme 96 del qual ti fascian ventiquattro piante.
query.result:
88 And to the chair that was already kind 89 more to the poor righteous, not because of her, 90 but for the one who sits, who drags,
91 not to dispense either two or three for six, 92 not the fortune of first vacant, 93 not tithes, which are of the poor of God,
94 added, but against the wandering world 95 license to fight for the seed 96 of which they make you twenty‑four plants.

97 Then, with doctrine and with will together, 98 with the apostolic office he moved, 99 like a torrent that presses a high vein;
100 and in the heretical thickets he struck, 101 his impulse, more vivacious there, 102 where the resistances were larger.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Di lui si fecer poi diversi rivi 104 onde l’orto catolico si riga, 105 sì che i suoi arbuscelli stan più vivi.
query.result: 103 Of him were then made various streams 104 whereby the Catholic garden is straightened, 105 so that its little trees stand more alive.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Se tal fu l’una rota de la biga 107 in che la Santa Chiesa si difese 108 e vinse in campo la sua civil briga,
109 ben ti dovrebbe assai esser palese 110 l’eccellenza de l’altra, di cui Tomma 111 dinanzi al mio venir fu sì cortese.
query.result:
106 If such was the one wheel of the biga 107 in which the Holy Church defended itself 108 and won in the field its civil quarrel,
109 well it should be very clear to you 110 the excellence of the other, of which Tomma 111 before my arrival it was so courteous.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Ma l’orbita che fé la parte somma 113 di sua circunferenza, è derelitta, 114 sì ch’è la muffa dov’ era la gromma.
query.result: 112 But the orbit that made the highest part 113 of its circumference, is neglected, 114 so that it is the mold where the gromma was.

115 His family, which moved straight 116 with the feet to its footprints, is so turned, 117 that that in front of that of behind throws;
118 and soon it will be seen of the harvest 119 of the bad cultivation, when the loglio 120 will lament that the ark there is taken away.

121 Well I say, who searched leaf by leaf 122 our volume, would still find paper 123 where one would read “I am that which I sow”;
124 but it will not be from Casel nor from Acquasparta, 125 there from where such come to the writing, 126 that one flees it and another restrains it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Io son la vita di Bonaventura 128 da Bagnoregio, che ne’ grandi offici 129 sempre pospuosi la sinistra cura.
query.result: 127 I am the life of Bonaventura 128 from Bagnoregio, who in the great offices 129 always I could the left care

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Illuminato e Augustin son quici, 131 che fuor de’ primi scalzi poverelli 132 che nel capestro a Dio si fero amici.
query.result: 130 Illuminated and Augustine are here, 131 who were among the first barefoot poor, 132 who in the capestro made themselves friends of God.

133 Ugo from San Vittore is here with them, 134 and Pietro Mangiadore and Pietro Spano, 135 who down shines in twelve little books;
136 Natàn prophet and the metropolitan 137 Crisostomo and Anselmo and that Donato 138 who to the first art deemed worthy to lay a hand.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Rabano è qui, e lucemi dallato 140 il calavrese abate Giovacchino 141 di spirito profetico dotato.
query.result: 139 Rabano is here, and Lucemi endowed 140 the Calabrian abbot Giovacchino 141 endowed with prophetic spirit.

142 To envy such a knight 143 moved me the inflamed courtesy 144 of Brother Thomas and the discreet Latin;
145 and this company moved me.
